member.name: T:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram
member.summary: Histogram for tracking the frequency of observations of values below interval upper bounds. This class is useful for recording timings in nanoseconds across a large number of observations when high performance is required.

member.name: M:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.#ctor(System.Int64[])
member.summary: Create a new Histogram with a provided list of interval bounds.
member.param: upperBounds of the intervals.

member.name: M:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.GetUpperBoundAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the upper bound of an interval for an index.
member.param: index of the upper bound.
member.returns: the interval upper bound for the index.

member.name: M:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.GetCountAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the count of observations at a given index.
member.param: index of the observations counter.
member.returns: the count of observations at a given index.

member.name: M:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.AddObservation(System.Int64)
member.summary: Add an observation to the histogram and increment the counter for the interval it matches.
member.param: value for the observation to be added.
member.returns: return true if in the range of intervals otherwise false.

member.name: M:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.AddObservations(Disruptor.Collections.Histogram)
member.summary: Add observations from another Histogram into this one. Histograms must have the same intervals.
member.param: histogram from which to add the observation counts.

member.name: M:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.Clear
member.summary: Clear the list of interval counters.

member.name: M:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.GetUpperBoundForFactor(System.Double)
member.summary: Get the interval upper bound for a given factor of the observation population.
member.param: factor representing the size of the population.
member.returns: the interval upper bound.

member.name: P:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.Size
member.summary: Size of the list of interval bars.

member.name: P:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.Count
member.summary: Count total number of recorded observations.
member.returns: the total number of recorded observations.

member.name: P:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.Min
member.summary: Get the minimum observed value.

member.name: P:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.Max
member.summary: Get the maximum observed value.

member.name: P:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.Mean
member.summary:
Calculate the mean of all recorded observations.
The mean is calculated by the summing the mid points of each interval multiplied by the count for that interval, then dividing by the total count of observations. The max and min are considered for adjusting the top and bottom bin when calculating the mid point.

member.name: P:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.TwoNinesUpperBound
member.summary: Calculate the upper bound within which 99% of observations fall.

member.name: P:Disruptor.Collections.Histogram.FourNinesUpperBound
member.summary: Calculate the upper bound within which 99.99% of observations fall.

member.name: T:Disruptor.BatchEventProcessor`1
member.summary:
Convenience class for handling the batching semantics of consuming events from a and delegating the available events to a .
If the also implements it will be notified just after the thread is started and just before the thread is shutdown.

member.summary: A group of set up via the
member.typeparam: the type of event used by the s.

member.name: M:Disruptor.IEventHandlerGroup`1.Then(Disruptor.IEventHandler{`0}[])
member.summary:
Set up s to consume events from the ring buffer. These handlers will only process events after every event processor in this group has processed the event.
This method is generally used as part of a chain. For example if the handler A must process events before handler B: dw.consumeWith(A).then(B);
member.param: handlers the batch handlers that will consume events.
member.returns: a that can be used to set up a over the created s.

member.name: M:Disruptor.IEventHandlerGroup`1.ConsumeWith(Disruptor.IEventHandler{`0}[])
member.param: the that will consume events.
member.returns: a that can be used to set up an over the created s.

member.summary:
for ensuring each sequence is handled by only a single processor, effectively consuming the sequence.
No other s in the will consume the same sequence.

member.param: ringBuffer to which events are published.
sequenceBarrier on which it is waiting.
workHandler is the delegate to which events are dispatched.

member.summary: Claim the next sequence in the The caller should be held up until the claimed sequence is available by tracking the dependentSequences.

cursor to serialise against.
batchSize of the sequence.

member.name: T:Disruptor.MultiThreadedClaimStrategy
member.summary:
Strategy to be used when there are multiple publisher threads claiming sequences.
This strategy is reasonably forgiving when the multiple publisher threads are highly contended or working in an environment where there is insufficient CPUs to handle multiple publisher threads. It requires 2 CAS operations for a single publisher, compared to the MultithreadedLowContention strategy which needs only a single CAS and a lazySet per publication.

member.summary: Construct a new multi-threaded publisher for a given buffer size.
member.param: bufferSize for the underlying data structure.

member.summary: Is there available capacity in the buffer for the requested sequence.
member.param: availableCapacity remaining in the buffer.
dependentSequences to be checked for range.
member.returns: true if the buffer has capacity for the requested sequence.

member.summary: Claim the next sequence in the The caller should be held up until the claimed sequence is available by tracking the dependentSequences.
member.param: dependentSequences to be checked for range.
member.returns: the index to be used for the publishing.

member.name: M:Disruptor.MultiThreadedClaimStrategy.IncrementAndGet(System.Int32,Disruptor.Sequence[])
member.summary: Increment sequence by a delta and get the result. The caller should be held up until the claimed sequence batch is available by tracking the dependentSequences.
member.param: delta to increment by.
dependentSequences to be checked for range.
member.returns: the result after incrementing.

member.name: T:Disruptor.SleepingWaitStrategy
member.summary:
Sleeping strategy that uses a while the s are waiting on a barrier.
This strategy is a good compromise between performance and CPU resource. Latency spikes can occur after quiet periods.

member.name: T:Disruptor.BlockingWaitStrategy

Blocking strategy that uses a lock and condition variable for s waiting on a barrier.
This strategy should be used when performance and low-latency are not as important as CPU resource.

member.name: T:Disruptor.YieldingWaitStrategy
member.summary:
Yielding strategy that uses a Thread.Sleep(0) for s waiting on a barrier after an initially spinning.
This strategy is a good compromise between performance and CPU resource without incurring significant latency spikes.

member.name: T:Disruptor.BusySpinWaitStrategy
member.summary:
Busy Spin strategy that uses a busy spin loop for s waiting on a barrier.
This strategy will use CPU resource to avoid syscalls which can introduce latency jitter. It is best used when threads can be bound to specific CPU cores.
